Title: A 5-STAR PRODUCT IF THERE EVER WAS ONE!!!
review: Don't listen to the nay-sayers. This is GREAT soap. I use it every day and when camping or travelling it is all I take. I can bathe completely, then shampoo my hair, and even shave with it. It suds really well and has a wonderful feel that will leave you squeaky clean but won't dry you out. Wifey likes it too. She says it leaves her face and skin soft and moist. And as an added bonus, it doesn't completely trash my tubs and showers like almost every other bar soap on the planet. For those who might not know this, that nasty crud that builds up on your tubs and showers is almost completely made up of the scum left behind by the talc and lye in your "normal" soaps, body washes and shampoos. For this reason, Pears transparent, glycerin-based soap is the only one allowed in my house, along with a few other clear body washes and shampoos. The rule of thumb here is, if you can't see through it it isn't welcome in my bathrooms. I have 4 people under my roof, and nasty tubs and showers used to cause a lot of grief. Now it isn't a problem at all. A thorough cleaning is only necessary a few times a year and it takes just a few minutes without the usual harsh, toxic chemicals. This reason alone should be enough to love this soap. The unique smell does take a little getting used to. It isn't strong or offensive mind you, but it is definitely unlike any other bar of soap. Wifey, who has overly sensitive bloodhound nostrils and hates all strong odors, does love the smell of Pears soap. Anyway, it is mostly just neutral, so we can choose how we will smell based solely on the aftershaves, perfumes and colognes we decide to go with. I don't know about any "new formulas vs old formulas", or whatever some folks are griping about. I just know it is a great soap now and it always had been a great soap. It is one of my favorite household discoveries of the last 40 years. Again, don't listen to the nay-sayers. Try it for a month and you will agree. Use it along with clear body washes and shampoos for 6 months and you will never go back to scrubbing soap scum once a month. A five star product if there ever was one!

Title: I was pleased to discover it in the 99 cent stores
review: I first tried Pears in 1973, when I lived in the UK. I have very sensitive skin, but found it gentle, and I adore the fragrance. Over the years, in the USA, it has proved difficult to find. Most drugstore chains do not carry it. I was pleased to discover it in the 99 cent stores, but it was not that cheap - a dollar a bar. But I was very happy to be able to recreate the experience of using a mild, gentle, soap that was actually quite long-lasting. I was pleased to see that Amazon sells a dozen bars for considerably less than my local discount stores. I had not read the reviews of this product before purchasing it, and frankly, I can't understand the negative reviews. There are no soaps that are "all natural." Does anyone here know how soap is made? It used to be made at home, using lard and lye (sodium hydroxide), an extremely caustic substance. People are needlessly afraid of "chemicals" that are present in virtually all retail toiletries. I am a health professional with an additional background in the hard sciences, and I must say that there is needless controversy over the "chemicals." I find many people similarly terrified of the substances of vaccines, and they shouldn't be. If you have a particular sensitivity or allergy to one of the components of this soap, your point is well taken, but this will not be true for everyone. If that were so, the product would never have made it to market. In addition, is only recently that full disclosure of the constituents of such products was mandated, so perhaps Pears has not changed as much as you think it has.

Title: This is great soap, ignore the nay-sayers
review: A couple of years back Pears decided to reformulate its soap, including changing its distinctive scent. This was an odd move, given that this is (I believe) the longest-running product in the world, and given that people don't like change. But once you get used to the new scent, or if you weren't familiar with the old scent in the first place, this is excellent glycerine soap. Pears soap is free from animal products, which is important to those of us who are vegetarian or vegan. I find the scent pleasing. It's long-lasting soap compared to other glycerine soaps that I've used. It doesn't go mushy, like other glycerine soaps. And one of the famous features of this soap is that the sliver of old soap fits neatly into the hollow on a new bar, so that you don't waste any of it. The price is also very reasonable. Many of the glycerine soaps in my local health-food store are $5 or so per bar. I'd highly recommend this soap.

Title: It was only a mattr of time before somebody figured this out. What a revelation!
review: Extraordinary oil, indeed! My hair was pin-straight, long and silky most of my life, but since I have gotten older, and regularly dye it, the strands have become a little more wiry, dry, stubborn and flyaway.more prone to just stick out, or stick together. So I tried leaving conditioner on forever, then adding a few drops of coconut oil or almond oil, and combing it through, but both of those oils were sticky. Then I triad argan oil, and finally tamed the wayward strands. What a revelation! I guess it was only a matter of time before somebody smart added oils to the shampoo and conditioner. I love this stuff! The shampoo foams up well, and rinses out well. The conditioner is luxurious; your hair untangles immediately and feels slippery. It feels like it takes a little extra time to fully rinse and dry your hair, but it is so well-behaved when you're done! I actually tried adding three drops of argan oil afterwards, but that was overkill. In fact, I discovered that my hair behaves even better on the second day, and maybe the third day, so now I wash it every other day.

Title: Smells nice, cleans well
review: I tried this shampoo on a whim as the kind I've been using for years was not available. I was a bit unsure of how it'd be, but I have no complaints with it. It lathers and cleans nicely, and rinses well - doesn't leave your hair feeling heavy/weighed down or residue-y like some shampoos tend to do. My hair is left feeling clean and lightweight with volume and softness. I also have not had any issues with it affecting my hair color. I have natural blonde hair but I lighten it a bit, and so far it has not affected my hair color in any way. However, I am not sure how or even if it would affect hair color at all if you dye your hair a darker or different shade than your natural color, versus lightening it.
